alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 1:17AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Bailey and Parmer Counties through 145 AM CDT... At 116 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles south of Bellview to 5 miles southwest of West Camp. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Muleshoe, Friona, Bovina, Farwell, Progress, Oklahoma Lane, Lariat, Rhea, West Camp, Black and Lazbuddie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
